Elizabeth wel<lb n="c57-0140__main__11"/>comed me with warm affection – yet <lb n="c57-0140__main__12"/>tears were in her eyes as she beheld <lb n="c57-0140__main__13"/>my ematiated frame & feverish <del rend="strikethrough">eyes</del><add hand="#pbs" place="superlinear">cheeks</add>. I <lb n="c57-0140__main__14"/>also saw a change in her—She was thinner <lb n="c57-0140__main__15"/>and had lost much of that heavenly viva<lb n="c57-0140__main__16"/>city that had before charmed me– <lb n="c57-0140__main__17"/>But her softness & gentle looks of com<lb n="c57-0140__main__18"/>passion made her more fit for one <lb n="c57-0140__main__19"/>blasted & miserable as I was.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0140__main__20"/>The calm <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough">hower</del> however which <lb n="c57-0140__main__21"/>I now enjoyed did not last. Recollection <lb n="c57-0140__main__22"/>brought madness with it– And when <lb n="c57-0140__main__23"/>I thought of what <add hand="#pbs" place="superlinear">had</add> passed a realinsani<lb n="c57-0140__main__24"/>ty possessed me – Sometimes I was furious <lb n="c57-0140__main__25"/>& burnt with rage sometimes low &des<lb n="c57-0140__main__26"/>pondant I neither spoke or looked <lb n="c57-0140__main__27"/>but sat motionless bewildered by the <lb n="c57-0140__main__28"/>multitude of miseries that overcame <lb n="c57-0140__main__29"/>me. Elizabeth alone had the power <lb n="c57-0140__main__30"/>to draw me from these fits – Her gentle <lb n="c57-0140__main__31"/>voice would sooth <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough">m</del> when passionate <lb n="c57-0140__main__32"/>and inspire with <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough">earthly</del> human fee<lb n="c57-0140__main__33"/>lings when sunk in torpor – She wept</zone> </surface>
